results.title: Querelle [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dieter Schidor, Planet Films, Gaumont and Rainer Werner Fassbinder
results.brief_description: Fassbinder’s final film is a stylised attempt to bring Jean Genet’s novel “Querelle de Brest” to the screen. Filmed in rich reds and oranges, “Querelle” is set in a hallucinatory world. The sailor Querelle is adored and loved by his Lieutenant, by the brothel-owner Lucienne and by her husband, Nono, but it isn’t until Querelle kills a man that he himself becomes ready to love. He chooses for his lover the murderer Gilles: a love which leads to a complex game of sexual betrayal and, ironically, both to tragedy and redemption. “Querelle” is like watching love unfold in the middle of a wet dream. Stars Brad Davis, Jeanne Moreau, Franco Nero and Laurent Malet. Screenplay, Rainer Werner Fassbinder and Burkhard Driest. Cinematography, Xaver Schwarzenberger and Josef Vavra. Music, Peer Raben. Editing, Juliane Lorenz and Frantz Walsch.

results.title: Quelque Part, Quelqu'un = Somewhere, Someone
results.brief_description:
Raphaelle, a young architect, is attempting to balance the demands of her work with the needs of the men around her. One of these men with needs is Vincent, her boyfriend, whom she tries to rescue from alcholic stupor in the hope he will finish his novel.

Credits: Director, Yannick Bellon ; writer, Yannick Bellon ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Loleh Bellon, Roland Dubillard, Christine Tsingos, Hugues Quester, Helene Dieudonne.

results.title: Queer as folk. Series 01. Eps. 01-08 [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Nicola Shindler, Red Productions, Channel Four, Charles McDougall and Sarah Harding
results.brief_description: Season one of the uncompromising 8 part British series which chronicles the hedonistic lifestyle and sexual exploits of a group of 20 something single gay men. ‘Episode one’ (director Charles McDougall): The series opens with the Dr. Who obsessed Vince Tyler (Craig Kelly) giving us a run down of what happens on a regular night out with his friends on Canal street, a popular gay strip in London. We are introduced to his egotistical and unscrupulous best friend, Stuart Jones (Aiden Gillen), who has just scored his latest conquest, the 15 year old and recently ‘out’, Nathan Maloney (Charlie Hunnman). Initially just a one night stand for Stuart, Nathan becomes infatuated with him, much to Vince’s displeasure who harbors his own secret crush for his best friend. ‘Episode two’ (director Charles McDougall): Vince is not ‘out’ at work, which leads to an awkward situation with one of his female co-workers. Nathan’s mother discovers gay pornography in his bedroom. Stewart brings his new born baby home from the hospital which he is co-parenting with a lesbian couple. ‘Episode three’ (director Charles McDougall): Nathan - still obsessed with Stuart, goes to Canal street with his best friend Donna (Carla Henry) to find him. Stuart, however, goes home with two other men that night. Vince’s friend Phil (Jason Merrells) picks up a stranger with deadly consequences. ‘Episode four’ (director Charles McDougall): Vince and Stuart attend Phil’s funeral, where Vince meets Cameron (Peter O’Brien). Nathan runs away from home when his mother confronts him about his sexuality and ends up at Vince’s mothers house. ‘Episode five’ (director Sarah Harding): Vince and Cameron go on a date. Stuart learns from his sister Janice (Caroline O’Neill) that their parents are getting divorced. ‘Episode six’ (director Sarah Harding): Stuart unsuccessfully tries to smooth out Nathan’s troubled family situation. Cameron meets Vince’s mother (Denise Black). ‘Episode seven’ (director Sarah Harding): Stuart helps throw a surprise party for Vince’s 30th birthday, then tries to sabotage Vince and Cameron’s relationship. ‘Episode eight’ (director Sarah Harding): Stuart’s world begins to crumble around him. Vince realises that Cameron’s hold on him is too restricting. Nathan decides to run away from home. (Written by Russell T Davies)

results.title: Queer as folk 2. What the folk...?
results.creator_credit: Red Productions, Channel Four, Nicola Shindler, Russell T. Davies and Menhaj Huda
results.brief_description: Follow up to the controversial British series which follows the trials and sexual exploits of a group of gay men in London. This second series was created as a one off finale and re-teams the three main protagonists from the first season. The hedonistic Stuart (Aidan Gillan), his long suffering best friend Vince (Craig Kelly), and the recently ‘out’ teenager Nathan (Charlie Hunnam). “Queer as folk 2” still focuses on the same milieu of Canal street, the gay district of the first series, but this time around centers on the relationship between Vince and Stuart. Will the two best friends finally consummate their relationship? Will Stuart come out to his parents? Will the impressionistic Nathan finally get over Stuart or follow in his footsteps? Also included is “What the folk…?” (25 mins), a short documentary on the making of the infamous series featuring interviews with the leads and writer Russell T. Davies. Cast includes Denise Black, Antony Cotton and Andy Devine.

results.title: Queensland's first films 1895-1910
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Almost all of Queensland’s film production for the 1890s has survived, and it offers a rare opportunity to see Australias colonial era come to life. This video contains highlights of the motion picture legacy of the of the pioneering exhibitors and filmmakers. Thoroughly researched and narrated by film historian Chris Long, this video opens a window into the colonial era and is a timely reminder of the crucial role played by factual film in the film in the first hundred years of cinema.

results.title: Queensland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Beginning with Brisbane’s elegant houses, this Queensland travel video also moves inland and along the expansive coastline. Enjoy the recreational activities on Hamilton Island, join a backpack tour that includes scuba diving, bush walking and horse riding, experience the Stockman’s Hall of Fame and the waterhole which inspired the Waltzing Matilda legend, visit the beaches of Surfer’s Paradise and Noosa, kayak in the Daintree Forest or sail to tranquil locations in the Whitsuday Islands.

results.title: Queensland
results.creator_credit: Chris Fitchett, Film Noir Productions and John Ruane
results.brief_description: This film deals with the fragility of relationships, goals and dreams. The film is a sensitively drawn image of working class existence in one of Melbourne’s industrial suburbs. It is about Doug, who has always wanted to go to Queensland and about his plans that do not work as they are expected to. Stars John Flaus.

results.title: Queen Victoria's empire
results.creator_credit: Paul Burgess, Paul Bryers, Brook Lapping, Devillier Donegan Enterprises and Public Broadcasting Service (U.S.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Empires”.
At the time of Queen Victoria’s birth in 1819 England was an agrarian society; within a few short decades this nation would be transformed into an industrial superpower, with an empire spanning the globes. This captivating four part series covers the transition with historical re-enactments, stills and interviews with historians, providing a portrait of Queen Victoria and British imperialism. Episode 1. “Engines of change”: Explores the changes brought to Britain by the industrial revolution, urban migration, overcrowding, extremes in poverty and pollution of the 1840s and Prince Albert’s role. Episode 2. “Passage to India”: In the 1850s, as steamships take British goods around the globe, tensions rise in India with a clash of Victorian values and Indian culture, resulting in the Great Mutiny and Cawnpore massacre of 1857; also covers the Crimean War and the death of Prince Albert. Episode 3. “The Moral Crusade”: By 1861 Britain is the wealthiest and most powerful nation on earth; David Livingstone’s explorations of the African interior fascinate the British public; Disraeli and Gladstone battle for control of the government; colonisation of Africa begins. Episode 4. “The scramble for Africa”: The Suez Canal is threatened by a holy war in the Sudan; Cecil Rhodes prospects diamond deposits in South Africa and asserts regional control; the Boer War leads to devastating British losses; Queen Victoria’s death marks the end of an era.

results.title: Queen of the border
results.brief_description: A film on the border town of Hawick, at work and at play. Hawick’s fame rests not only o its ancient battle honours, commemorated for three days every year, but on the sweaters which its craftsmen have knitted for generations, and which the film shows in process of manufacture.
